content: pink panther by gretchen ceule the pink panther shawl is designed for a relaxing knitting experience eyelet row are interspersed within the garter stitch adding charming detail the shawl is worked from one tip to the center with increases as you knit and then decreases toward the other tip the result is a long narrow shawl that is reversible and easy to style to create a lightweight and cozy shawl hold two strands of lace-weight yarn including one with a fluffy texture such as suri alpaca alternatively you can knit the shawl with a single strand of dk weight yarn or other yarn combinations that achieve a similar weight pi nk pan ther shell awl pa g e | 2 yarn dk weight yarn approx 410 yds sample is knit with 2 heavy lace weights yarns held together throughout  la bien aimee felix 75% falkland merino 25% corriedale 650 m 710 yds for 100 g  la bien aimee kumo 74% suri alpaca 26% mulberry silk 300m 328 yds for 50 g notes  using a lace with suri alpaca like kumo lets the fibers of the yarn expand making it close to a dk a single strand of dk or two fingering weights held together will also work  pattern is formatted so that you should only need to print pages 2 &
